questions.clue: This enigmatic woman in a famous portrait by Leonardo da Vinci is believed to be Lisa Gherardini.
This Dutch painter's self-portrait with a bandaged ear reflects his tumultuous life.
This Spanish artist painted the 'Third of May 1808', depicting the execution of Spanish rebels by Napoleonic troops.
This English monarch was famously painted by Hans Holbein the Younger in a regal portrait standing with arms akimbo.
This French military leader is depicted crossing the Alps in a dramatic painting by Jacques-Louis David.
This method of food preservation, used in ancient times, involves removing moisture to inhibit bacterial growth.
Developed in the 20th century, this kitchen appliance uses rapid air circulation to mimic deep frying.
This French term refers to a technique where food is vacuum-sealed and cooked to precise temperatures in a water bath.
Discovered by accident in 1945, this appliance revolutionizes cooking by using electromagnetic radiation to heat food.
This revolutionary cuisine style, pioneered by chefs like Ferran Adrià, uses scientific techniques like foams and spherification.
This one-horned creature, often depicted as a white horse, is a symbol of purity and grace.
Originating in China, this legendary creature is often associated with water and is said to bring good fortune.
In Greek mythology, this creature is part lion, part goat, and part serpent.
This creature from Japanese folklore is known for its shape-shifting ability and is often depicted as a fox.
In Norse mythology, this monstrous wolf is prophesied to kill Odin during Ragnarok.
This process describes the movement of water from the Earth's surface into the atmosphere.
These high-altitude, ice-crystal clouds are known for their thin, wispy appearance.
This term refers to the boundary where two different air masses meet, often causing precipitation.
Named after an ancient Roman god, this scale measures the intensity of tornadoes.
This phenomenon, associated with the warming of sea surface temperatures in the Pacific, can disrupt global weather patterns.
It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
Call me Ishmael.
It was the best of times, it was the worst of times, it was the age of wisdom, it was the age of foolishness.
All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit.

final.clue: First published in 1605, this novel follows a nobleman who reads so many chivalric romances that he loses his sanity and becomes a knight-errant.
